head.note: This manuscript record does not have a summary list of contents. For composite manuscripts, the list of contents can be found under each individual part.

listRelation.desc: This composite manuscript consists of 2 distinct parts:

altIdentifier.collection: William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838
William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: A Jacobite Lectionary from the Gospels for the whole year. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 86 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: A Jacobite Lectionary from the Gospels for the whole year.
msItem.note: The lessons are taken from the Harklensian text.

msItem.title: The Commemoration of the blessed Virgin
The first Sunday after the Nativity, the Massacre of the Innocents
msItem.rubric: ܩܪ̈ܝܢܐ ܕܚܕܒܫܒܐ ܕܒܬܪ ܒܝܬ ܝ̇ܠܕܐ܀ ܕܩ̣ܛܠܐ ܕܝܠܘ̈ܕܐ

msItem.title: The Commemoration ofS. John the Baptist
The Presentation of our Lord in the Temple
The first Sunday after the Epiphany
msItem.rubric: ܩܪ̈ܝܢܐ ܕܚܕܒܫ̈ܒܐ ܕܒܬܪ ܒܝܬ ܕܢܚܐ܀ ܕܚܕܒܫܒܐ ܩܕܡܝܐ ܕܒܬܪ ܥܐܕܐ

msItem.title: Passion (or Holy) Week
msItem.rubric: ܩܪ̈ܝܢܐ ܕܫܒܬܐ ܩܕܝܫܬܐ ܕܚܫ̣ܐ ܦܪܘܩܝܐ ܕܡܪܝܐ

msItem.title: The Week of White Garments (in albis)
The second Sunday after the Resurrection
The Ascension of our Lord
msItem.rubric: ܛܟܣܐ ܥܐܕܐ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܕܣܠܩܗ(sic) ܕܡܪܢ ܘܐܠܗܢ ܕܠܫܡܝܐ

msItem.title: The sixth Sunday after the Resurrection
The Friday of Gold (seeActs, ch. iii. v. 6), the Commemoration ofSS. Peter, John, and Paul
msItem.rubric: ܩܪ̈ܝܢܐ ܕܥܪܘܒܬܐ ܕܕܗܒܐ ܕܘܟܪܢܐ ܕܦܐܛܪܘܣ ܝܘܚܢܢ ܘܦܘܠܘܣ

msItem.title: The Friday of the Commemoration of the Apostles
The first Sunday after the Fast of the Apostles
The Fast of the three holy Children
The first Sunday after the Fast of the three holy Children
The Dedication of the Cross and the Consummation of the World
msItem.rubric: ܩܪ̈ܝܢܐ ܕܚ̈ܘܕܬܐ ܕܨܠܝܒܐ ܦܪܘܩܝܐ ܘܕܫܘܼܠܡܗ ܕܥܠܡܐ

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 9 1/8 in. by 6 3/4, consisting of 276 leaves, a few of which are much stained and slightly torn, especially foll. 2, 4, 35, 275 and 276. The quires, 25 in number, are signed with letters; but of the first only four leaves remain. Each page has from 18 to 25 lines. Large portions of this volume are palimpsest (see Add. 14,490, lower text ).

collation.p: The quires, 25 in number, are signed with letters; but of the first only four leaves remain.

item.p: 276 leaves, a few of which are much stained and slightly torn, especiallyfoll. 2, 4, 35, 275 and 276. Large portions of the manuscript are palimpsest.

layout.p: Each page has from 18 to 25 lines.

handNote.desc: This volume, large portions of which are palimpsest, is written in a rather inelegant Estrangela, and dated A. Gr. 1400, A.D. 1089. Many of the titles are written with green and yellowish brown paint.

item.label: Colophon
item.p: Onfol. 275 a, after the doxology, there is the following note, informing us that this lectionary was written and bound, in the year1400(A.D. 1089), atthe convent of S. Mary Deipara near Alexandria, by a recluse and stylite namedSamuel bar Cyriacus bar Abraham, from a place in the East calledNirabā(ܢܪܒܐ,), inthe district of Ma'dān(ܡ̇ܥܕܢ, seeAssemani, Bibl. Or., t. ii., Dissert. de Monopliys., art. ix., Maadan).

p.quote: ܫܠܡ ܦܘܪܫ ܩܪ̈ܝܢܐ ܕܐܘܢܓܠܝܘܢ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܡܬܝ ܡܪܩܘܣ ܠܘܩܐ ܝܘܚܢܢ. ܕܡܬܩܪܝܢ ܒܥܕܬܐ ܩܕܝܫܬܐ ܒܟܠܗ̇ ܚܘܕܪܐ ܕܫܢܬܐ ܡܫܡܠܝܐܝܬ ܕܠܐ ܒܘܨܪܐ. ܟܠ ܕܝܢ ܕܩ̇ܪܐ ܘܝܘܬܪܢܐ ܩ̇ܢܐ ܡܢ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܚ̈ܝܐ . ܢܨ̈ܠܐ̣ ܒܚ̇ܦܝܛܘܬܐ ܥܠ ܫܡܘܐܝܠ ܒܨܝܪܐ ܘܩܫܝܫܐ ܒܫܡܐ ܘܚܒܝܫܝܐ. ܒܪ ܩܘܪܝܩܘܣ ܒܪ ܐܒܪܗܡ ܡܢ̈ܚܐ. ܡܢ ܐܪܥܐ ܕܡܕܢܚܐ ܡܢ ܢܪܒܐ ܕܡ̇ܥܕܢ ܡܕܝܢܬܐ ܕܢܚ̇ܫܐ. ܐܬܟܬܒ ܕܝܢ ܘܐܬ݁ܕܒܲܩ ܒܐ̈ܝܕܝ ܒܨܝܪܐ ܕܐܡ̣ܝܪ. ܫܢ̣ܬ ܐܠܦ ܘܐܪ̈ܒܥܡܐܐ ܕܝܘ̈ܢܝܐ ܒ܏ܝܛ ܒܝܠܠ (sic) ܝܪܚܐ ܒܝܘܡ ܬܠܬܐ ܒܫܒܐ. ܒܐܣܛܘܢܐ ܒܩܠܝܡܐ ܕܐܠܟܣܢܕܪܝܐ ܪܒܬܐ ܘܕܡܨܪܝܢ. ܒܕܝܪܐ ܕܒܝܬ ܝ̇ܠܕܬ ܐܠܗܐ ܡܪܝܡ. ܕܐܠܗܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܛܠ ܫܡܗ ܥܡ̣ܠ ܘܐܝܨܦ ܘܦܲܪܫ ܘܛ̇ܟܣ ܘܟܬܒ ܘܣܡ ܣܝܡܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܐܠܗܝܬܐ ܏ܘܫ.

origin.origDate: This lectionary was written and bound, in the year 1400 (A.D. 1089)
origin.origPlace: The convent of S. Mary Deipara near Alexandria

head.note: This manuscript contains: Galen. Part of a Syriac translation of the works of Galen; Gesius. The notes or commentary of Gesius(Γέσιος,) arranged, it would appear, in parallel columns to the works ofGalen. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 2 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.author: Galen
msItem.title: Part of a Syriac translation of the works of Galen
msItem.note:
Foll. 1and276(a fragment) have not been rewritten. The running titles, which are still visible on the outer margins of some leaves. See, for example, foll.34 b, 74 b, 100 b, 144 b, 146 a and b, 155 b, 166 b, 178 b, 196 b, and 246 b. Other portions of the same text are to be found in Add. 17,127 ; and to it probably belong the palimpsest leaves in Add. 14,486 and
14,487
https://bl.syriac.uk/ms/177
.

msItem.author: Gesius
msItem.title: The notes or commentary of Gesius(Γέσιος,) arranged, it would appear, in parallel columns to the works ofGalen.
msItem.note:
Foll. 1and276(a fragment) have not been rewritten. The running titles, which are still visible on the outer margins of some leaves. See, for example, foll.34 b, 74 b, 100 b, 144 b, 146 a and b, 155 b, 166 b, 178 b, 196 b, and 246 b. Other portions of the same text are to be found in Add. 17,127 ; and to it probably belong the palimpsest leaves in Add. 14,486 and
14,487
https://bl.syriac.uk/ms/177
.

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 9 1/8 in. by 6 3/4. Large portions of this volume are palimpsest (see Add. 14,490, upper text ). Foll. 1 and 276 (a fragment) have not been rewritten.

item.p: Palimpsest.Foll. 1 and 276(a fragment) have not been rewritten.

layout.p: Arranged, it would appear, in parallel columns.

handNote.desc: The erased text of the palimpsest portions of this volume is written in a small, neat hand of the viiith or ixth cent.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.
